snippet: The Swiss central bank increased the amount it charges depositors to hold their cash, to little avail.
abstract: Value of Swiss franc soars after nation's central bank allows it to float freely against the euro, shocking global markets; decision follows steep decline in the euro, and shows turbulent state of a global economy in which many smaller nations are struggling to adapt to monetary activism by the Federal Reserve and the European Central Bank; abrupt action causes Swiss stocks to tumble, with impact falling hardest on exporters.

byline.original: By DAVID JOLLY and NEIL IRWIN
byline.contributor: David Jolly reported from Paris and Neil Irwin from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The Swiss central bank increased the amount it charges depositors to hold their cash, to little avail.

headline.main: Swiss Franc Soars After Central Bank Drops Cap
headline.print_headline: Franc Soars After Swiss Drop a Cap on Its Value
